item.title: Using Python in R Part 2!
item.description: Let’s find the volume of earth! library(reticulate) ## Warning: package 'reticulate' was built under R version 3.6.3 We know the radius of earth is approximately 6,378 miles long. #Python r=6378 We also know that the earth is (roughly) spherical in shape! #R 4*pi*(((py$r)^3)/3) ## [1] 1.086781e+12 v<-4*pi*(((py$r)^3)/3) We have found that earth’s volume is a really, really big number! It comes out to approximately 1086781000000 cubic miles! Want to convert that to cubic kilometers?

item.title: Using Python in R Studio
item.description: Want to know what Spongebob and Patrick are laughing about? Let me tell you using R and Python! library(reticulate) ## Warning: package 'reticulate' was built under R version 3.6.3 Python: s="Hey Patrick, I thought of something funnier than 24" R: print(py$s) ## [1] "Hey Patrick, I thought of something funnier than 24" z<-"Let me hear it" Python: r.z ## 'Let me hear it' y=24 R: py$y+1 ## [1] 25 l<-"lololol" Python:

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, Predicting
item.description: Introduction Main Variable Introduction The data set chosen was “pbc”. This data set contains information on a Mayo Clinic Trial for a Primary Biliary Cirrhosis (PBC) treatment. The set originally contained 418 observations, with each observation representing a patient involved in the trial. Any observation containing NAs were removed for the sake of simplicity, leaving 276 observations. During this trial, patients were either given the treatment, consiting of D-Penacillamine, or a placebo at random, and then different values and observations were tested and recorded.

item.title: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Introduction The first data set chosen was “GDP”. This data set contains information on the Gross Domestic Product (in billions) for the United States by quarter since 1947. The second data set chosen was “Unemployment”. This data set contains information on the unemployment rate (percentage) in the United States by year since 1948. The third data set chosen was “Presidents”. This data set contains a list of United States preisdent by year since 1947.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have recently completed using R Studio: Exploratory Data Analysis with Tidyverse Tools Modeling, Testing, and Classification
